Articles.Content: @h0yer As far as I know, RSSVE is just modified and expanded RVE, so merging it would make no sense. For me the most important difference between those two is that RSSVE disables Kopernicus' oblate features, thus making it's scatterer configs for outer planets possible.

5 hours ago, Phineas Freak said:

@Sol Invictus i do not have a problem with the redistribution per se but i am worried about impatient users asking for support for an "alpha version" of a mod. But I am happy that you guys and gals like it!

What i meant about RSSVE not being an RVE replacement is that the quality of my work cannot even reach the early versions of RVE. @pingopete has done an exceptional work with RVE and i applaud him for that.

Also, i should warn you that other sun flares are not really compatible if you do not make the changes that you mentioned previously. I hope that future versions of Scatterer will allow Module Manager - style patching so to simplify installation procedures.

You're graphics mod so far seems to work excellent. The sun flare looks great without astroniki, I finally get the red dawn and sunset I've seen in youtube videos I wasn't getting before. The water texture has been fixed (was not getting the upgraded water ripples with RVE). The clouds look better. I like it a lot. Thanks for the work. @Phineas Freak. I know it's still WIP, but that's okay. So far it's a lot better than what I had going on. I hope you start your own thread for this mod soon, so I can keep updated about the updates.

Edited August 1, 2016 by EliasDanger
By the way, is @pingopete still working at RVE?

Hi all!

I´ve been trying to get RVE+EVE+Scatterer working as instructed in this thread but here is my result so far;

Clouds look fine in the map view, but ground view shows black sky and the water is really something different from all the great pics posted in these forums.

Log here: http://s000.tinyupload.com/index.php?file_id=08831741985455890974

I´m sure the problem is my end and I´ve made some really embarassing rookie mistake with the mods. But I´m willing the take the heat from you guys if I can get these great mods to work and I get to start a new RSS career with some amazing graphics.

Cheers,

JuxuR

Edited August 2, 2016 by JuxuR

The space centre overview is often glitched like that. Have you checked whether it looks OK from the launch pad/runway in flight mode?

@JuxuR Looks like you don't have scatterer installed. Once I ended with identical result, because I didn't actually install scatterer, thinking it's bundled already with RVE. Check if you have scatterer.dll in your GameData/scatterer folder.

Did you make the changes to Scatterer's planetconfig file and rename the Kerbin and Duna folders as per the RSS section on the Scatterer first post or use the Scatterer files included in the RVE download?

6 hours ago, Aelfhe1m said:

Did you make the changes to Scatterer's planetconfig file and rename the Kerbin and Duna folders as per the RSS section on the Scatterer first post or use the Scatterer files included in the RVE download?

That was it, didn´t do this step correctly.

Thank you for your help!

JuxuR

On 7/29/2016 at 9:36 AM, h0yer said:

 

On 7/29/2016 at 8:18 AM, Theysen said:

Don't copy the GitHub scatterer settings over, they're outdated.

 

Just drop a manual scatterer install into GameData, change folder 'Kerbin' to 'Earth' and change the names in the planetslist.cfg both to Earth. Ingame open the scatterer GUI and set the 'ExperimentalAtmoScale' to 0.8 or less to have a somewhat reasonable atmosphere height. It should work out of the box.

Eureka! It worked, thanks mate

 

Although, I didn't FULLY follow the instructions, I just deleted the old Earth/Mars folders in the scatterer config folder and replaced them with the Kerbin/Duna folders from a freshly loaded scatterer package and manualy changed the XAS to 0.8 in the file without using the scatterer UI.

 

Again, thanks for your priceless help, I would just wait and bleed from my eyes until either KSP goes 1.2 or RVE goes 1.1.3

 

Just wanted to let everyone know, that I was having the same exact problem as @h0yer, and what worked for him worked for me as well. Thanks!

A quick question..

Will any of these solutions work on the 64 bit version (windoze) ?

Scatterer works, but with RVE so far I have no success trying all sorts of permutations.

Any tips for performance improvement in atmosphere?

I can typically max my framerate (140 fps) in orbit or in map view, and on a fast reentry (Moon) as soon as I hit the atmosphere I start hitting physics delta time limit at 30 fps. Gradually that eases up as I slow down - and it isn't nearly as bad on a launch (I figure rendering stuff flying by at 10.5 km/s is more challenging?). Without EVE or scatterer installed I have no fps issues on a reentry.

50 minutes ago, antilochus said:

Any tips for performance improvement in atmosphere?

Turn down Aero FX in KSP settings menu. (re-entry and mach effects). The lowest setting has a really big impact by leaving just the "skin glow".

12 minutes ago, SkyKaptn said:

Turn down Aero FX in KSP settings menu. (re-entry and mach effects). The lowest setting has a really big impact by leaving just the "skin glow".

Thanks. Should have noted that I have that setting at the lowest level. I guess it would be helpful to know if people have fps issues at high altitude re-entry (immediately on entering atmosphere). I'm not exactly sure what EVE/Scatterer/terrain texture implications are from going 142km to 138km but I think volumetric clouds might be the biggest culprit.

I finally found the time to get this mod working! Thank you so much for this amazing artwork @pingopete! 

Edited August 10, 2016 by Monsterlunch

Here's a more clear representation of the fps issue I'm having. 300m orbit looking across horizon, consistent ~100-150fps (150 if I look up)... and looking down, physics delta time hits the floor at 25 fps (i.e. my fps would be below 25).

A quick question..

Will any of these solutions work on the 64 bit version (windoze) ?

I have a partial answer, I just copied my (RSS/RO/RP-0) folder for this mod from 1.1.2 to 1.1.3 and so I have fully working clouds and scatterer although as I installed it a while ago I can`t remember the exact install procedure I followed but I can tell you that it`s working lovely although I only get half a planet of clouds in the menu screen and then only after I have gone into the game. On the way in Earth is bare. I run windoze 64 bit.

So, yes.

Hi everyone, I need help. I managed to get everything working except for the water. The ocean does not appear until I get into space. Also, whenever I move my camera to a certain position the screen goes white like my camera is positioned inside a cloud. If anyone can help me with these problems it would be greatly appreciated.

2 hours ago, hellblazer said:

Can you take a screenshot of your GameData folder and post it? 

http://imgur.com/a/JmSPX I hope this helps.

40 minutes ago, FallenPhoenixRA said:

http://imgur.com/a/JmSPX I hope this helps.

  1. Delete the BoulderCo folder
  2. I don't see your RVE folder (should be separate inside the GameData folder)
  3. If your using the 64bit KSP (which you should) download the RVE folder here: https://github.com/Pingopete/RVE-KSP-1.0.4  It works in 1.1.3

So you will need EVE, RVE (copy and paste the scatterer and texture replacer folders inside the RVE download into the GameData folder), scatterer and texture replacer. 

Let me know how you make out.
